intro: Orbeopsis elongata, commonly known as the elongated orbeopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular, pink to purple flowers. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils near streams or in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
